quest.name: Working Off the Meal
journal: Cassard is impressed by your gastronomic fortitude.
objectives: Use the market receipt to collect Cassard's purchases.
Deliver the Mord Souq merchandise to Cassard.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Gahahaha! You have courage, my friend! Rhon Ron's wares are more “exotic” than harmful, but I don't envy you the bellyache you'll have on the morrow.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Right. Now that you've eaten, I expect you're eager to get back on the road...

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: ...Would you mind if we delayed our departure a touch? I have a few deals left to close before I can conclude my business here in Mord Souq.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Oh! Offering your services, are you? Aye, well an assistant would certainly help hurry things along!

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: I have a receipt here for some goods that need picking up from the market. All properly paid for─you'd just need to do the lifting and carrying.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: I'll go and take care of some last-minute haggling, then. See you in a bit.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may view the market receipt at any time during this quest by using the relevant item in the Key Items menu.

dialogue.name: MEMO03293
dialogue.text:
(-Market Receipt-)Table cactus ─ Thon Ton
Iron ore ─ Thol Tol

dialogue.name: MEMO03293
dialogue.text: (-Market Receipt-)Nabaath Areng antiques ─ Mhil Mil (to be collected from Mhul Mul)

dialogue.name: THONTON
dialogue.text: Lift with your legs, and not with your back!♪

dialogue.name: THOLTOL
dialogue.text: Now, then! ...What was I doing, again?

dialogue.name: MHULMUL
dialogue.text: Hoohoo! Lovely, lovely pots!

dialogue.name: BHUNBUN
dialogue.text: Wait, what? No no no! This is Bhun Bun's private worm stash. Not for sale!

dialogue.name: RHONRON
dialogue.text: Hm? Hungry again already? You have a strong stomach, friend, but I wouldn't eat those!

dialogue.name: MHILMIL
dialogue.text: Hands off! That water is for Mhil Mil's footbath! ...Unless you have coin or barter?

dialogue.name: MHILMIL
dialogue.text: Oh, you work for Cassard? Mhul Mul has his antiques all boxed up and ready for transport!

dialogue.name: LATGAR
dialogue.text: If you're handling Cassard's porter work, you've come to the wrong place. He has no outstanding orders with my shop.

dialogue.name: THONTON
dialogue.text: You came in with Cassard, yes? Good, good, I can finally stop thinking about that sack. Please, take your prickly purchase!

dialogue.name: THOLTOL
dialogue.text: Cassard sent you, did he? Right. Yes. ...What kind of ore was it, again?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Copper ore!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Iron ore!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Tin ore!

dialogue.name: THOLTOL
dialogue.text: Yes! Wait, no. Are you sure? I don't seem to have any on hand...

dialogue.name: THOLTOL
dialogue.text: Iron ore, of course! That would explain this box I have here. It's all yours!

dialogue.name: MHULMUL
dialogue.text: Hey, no touching! That merchandise is spoken for! You couldn't possibly change my mind with a better offer...

dialogue.name: MHULMUL
dialogue.text: ...What? Cassard sent you!? Wh-Why didn't you say so? I wouldn't dream of selling his goods to a higher bidder! Oh no, no, no!

dialogue.name: MHULMUL
dialogue.text: Nabaath Areng relics, wasn't it? All packed in that box there. Handle with care!

dialogue.name: THONTON
dialogue.text: That's my business finished for the day! Come again if you need more spiky succulents!

dialogue.name: THOLTOL
dialogue.text: Now, then! ...Where was I going, again?

dialogue.name: MHULMUL
dialogue.text: Give my regards to Cassard, heh heh heh...

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Don't tell me you've been round the entire market already!?

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Aye, that's the lot, all right. Good work.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: And quick work, too, considering you've not set foot in the place before. I'd thought you one to sit in the city like the Exarch, but something tells me you're not a stranger to visiting strange lands...

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, your efficiency presents something of a problem. I'd hoped to conclude all my business before you returned, but it seems there's been some confusion over one of the orders I placed.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: I'll have to drag in my middleman and sort this mess out. I'm sorry to make you sit around and twiddle your thumbs...

dialogue.name: TESLEEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)...Cassard? It feels like an age since I last saw you!

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't the lovely Tesleen! It has been a while, but your timing couldn't be better.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: This ladygentleman was on herhis way to meet with Alisaie. I'm supposed to be taking herhim to your corner of the desert, but a misplaced order has commandeered my attention...

dialogue.name: TESLEEN
dialogue.text: ...Wait, I know who you are.

dialogue.name: TESLEEN
dialogue.text: Alisaie has told me so much about you! You're Forename, aren't you!?

dialogue.name: TESLEEN
dialogue.text: I knew it! How wonderful to meet you in the flesh after hearing all those stories!

dialogue.name: TESLEEN
dialogue.text: I'm Tesleen. I work as a carer at the Inn, and I've gotten to know Alisaie quite well since she took up guard duties there.

dialogue.name: TESLEEN
dialogue.text: Do you want me to take over as Forename's guide, Cassard? My shopping's all done and packed for the road, so it would be no trouble...

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: That would be a great help, thank you!

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Well, it looks like you'll be able to head straight out after all. My caravan and I will be in the area for a while yet─seek me out when you've had your fill of Amh Araeng, and I'll send you back to the Crystarium.

obj.n: Work to Live or Live to Work
